lines.text: C'mon, Big Eyes, ya killin' me. What's the matter?
It's Thanksgiving...
So, what's there to cry about? Ya don't like turkey?
Hey, aren't you a dinosaur?
Why, yes. From tooth to toe, I am.
Then, what are you doin' playing golf?
I'm smart, Buster. I'm a smart dinosaur. But... I wasn't always.
You weren't?
Oh, no. I started off stupid and violent.
You DID?
This was a long time ago, you understand? A LONG time ago. I was a real terror then. I was a real animal. And I was hungry, ALL the time!
Everybody, I'd like you to meet my new friend, Cecilia Nuthatch.
The name's Rex. Nice to meet you.
A pleasure Rex.
[curtsies]
Very nice to meet you.
...And I'm Dweeb! Hi!
A pleasure, Dweeb.
[curtsies]
Very nice to meet you.

[chuckling]
She's so well brought-up!
Alright, break it up. Enough with the pleasantries...
Brother! Brother, wait! When I am all alone... when I have no one to scare, I get very frightened myself.
I'm Rex. What's your name?
I think it's Louie, but seeing you guys is giving me doubts about my brain.
Heard your wish on my wish radio. "Let no bad happen." Very good. Couldn't agree more.
Let's face it... we've evolved.
Hey Stubbs! Where do you think you're goin'? Get back here!

Oh, I forgot to tell ya... I QUIT! I quit! Ha! I resign! Are you gettin' this completely in your ear? I am PROFOUNDLY outta here! And this ain't about money. I ain't even complaining about my dry cleaning bill. But hang around with elephants all day and try to keep YOUR clothes clean!
[audience laughs]
But that's not the point. The point is, I quit. Quittski! Over-and-outski! That's all she wrote! KEEP MY LAST CHECK, BUDDY!
[hands each item to Screweyes as he mentions it]

Here's my shoes, my nose, my horn, my buzzer, my fake arm, my bug-eye glasses, my backstage passes, my hat, my rabbit, HIS backstage passes, my fake fangs, a few birds, my pogo stick, my donkey ears, my extending tounge gag, my rubber chicken; Ya can't even get these anymore; my lucky whale tooth, and a giant clam that opens to reveal the American flag held by a mermaid and her normal brother, Richard!
[audience laughing]
SO LONG! Oh, and by the way, in case you're wondering why I'm talking and they're laughing, let me explain it to ya...

[Screams]
THAT'S! COMEDY!
Sorry about the way I acted. I was a real animal.
We all have regrets, Rex.
Tell me about it. The things I've stepped on.
They're not here. I missed them again because of my endless, shameless lateness. No matter, we'll rendezvous. We'll rendezvous.
Put him down, Rex. Rex, that means king. Be a king, Rex.

[Walks to the crane area where Louie and the dinosaurs just left]
Welcome to New York City!
[adjusts her glasses, realizes that those are cranes]
Oh, I missed them from apparent lateness. We'll rendezvous, we'll rendezvous.

[Not noticing as Rex runs and steps over her, puts a poster over the Professor Screweyes Eccentric Circus poster]
Dinosaur exhibit, the Museum of Natural History. You can't skimp out publicity.

[the kids are in costume, participating in the circus as a cover]
Louie, I feel so silly! What is wrong with these people?
I dunno, but I've never seen so many tonsils in my life!
[Louie and Cecilia are about to sign Prof. Screweyes' contract]
Louie, I'm scared.
You are? Good.

[describing his Fright Radio]
It picks up what people are scared to death of. You see, I find out what they're frightened of on this radio and that's what I try to give them with my circus. It's a public service, but this is the station that comes in the loudest of all.
[Prof. Screweyes has just shown off his Fright Radio to the kids and the dinosaurs]
You see what they're most afraid of?
No.
Monsters!
Monsters?
You!
Us?
Us?

[holding out a jar of glowing pills]
With a little help, yes.
What's that?
It's Brain Drain, the remedy to my brother's goody-two-shoes breakfast cereal. It'll take you back. It'll make you monsters.
But we don't want to be monsters.
We're not taking anything. You can forget it.
All right, you're free. You can go. I can't stop you. But the kids... are mine.
Do you want a hotdog? or do you want a HOTDOG?
Just get me to the circus and we'll say no more about it.
[He starts walking as the dinosaurs follow him, Rex bumps his head on one of the construction devices with a clang]
Ow! Ooh!
Be careful, will ya? I can't be savin' ya every two minutes.
